ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Course which provides new clinical students with a large amount of pragmatically useful skills.

In this course, we learn about current debates about how and when assessment should be used, learn how to administer a variety of assessments that are commonly used in research and practice, and write an integrated report using the results from these assessments. I would highly recommend this course to other students because it is an invaluable introduction to how to administer and report on common assessments, and builds a great foundation for future clinical work.
I would recommend this course to another student!
You will get an introduction to several assessments and develop critical thinking skills when it comes to evaluating them
I would definitely recommend this course to another student. It was a wonderful way to learn about and get practical experience with psychological assessment. It is a great course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Provided a survey of a the top assessments used in the field

This course helped me understand the strengths and weaknesses of assessments that are commonly used in my area of research as well as with clinical populations, which is very valuable. The knowledge I gained in this course helped me understand some of the clinical measures that are included in the data I am currently working with.
Increased my knowledge of measurement techniques in psychology; this is useful for research and practice.

This definitely shed light on my consideration of the purpose of assessment, in both clinical and research settings. Though a complicated topic, I feel I have the tools I need to move further as a clinician and researcher.
This course was extremely helpful in giving me insight into a field that I had little experience with but may want to pursue further in my clinical work.
